info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 1:10AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sully, central Stanley and northwestern Hughes Counties through 300 AM CDT/200 AM MDT/... At 209 AM CDT/109 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wendte, or 11 miles west of Fort Pierre, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fort Pierre and Chantier Creek Recreation Area around 125 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oahe Mission Rec Area, Overlook Rec Area, West Shore Rec Area, southern Lake Oahe, Spring Creek Rec Area, Cow Creek Rec Area, Okobojo Point Rec Area and Grey Goose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
